name: Triggers.vim
summary: Helps to toggle definitions (maps, sets, abbr)
description:
This big file defines functions that help to toggle the definitions of many things -- like mappings, settings 
or abbreviations. The very simple application is to map (/ unmap) a macro when we hit (/rehit) the trigger. 
A much more useful application is to map all the definitions from a function when hitting the trigger and 
unload them on a second hit and reload on a third, etc..

For examples of use, cf. the header part of the file, or  <http://hermitte.free.fr/vim/general.php >.
install_details: Copy the file wherever you want, but {rtp}macros or {rtp/plugin are fine places.

versions.release_notes:
The placement of the memorized undo files has changed to suit VIM6
systems, and older ones where we can't write files into $VIMRUNTIME.
The creation of the undo files is smoother ; vim should not insult us
anymore.

Bufferized maps and abbreviations (<buffer> for VIM6) are now valid and correctly handled.
And the two files required are now part of the archive.
Fix a little synchronisation problem between files thanks to an external script attached to the tarball archive.
